Org.OData.Aggregation.V1..@Core.Description: Terms to describe which data in a given entity model can be aggregated, and how.

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.ApplySupported.@Core.Description: This structured type or entity container supports the $apply system query option

Transformations.@Core.Description: Transformations that can be used in $apply

CustomAggregationMethods.@Core.Description: Qualified names of custom aggregation methods that can be used in aggregate(...with...)

Rollup.@Core.Description: The service supports rollup hierarchies in a groupby transformation

PropertyRestrictions.@Core.Description: Only properties tagged as Groupable can be used in the groupby transformation, and only those tagged as Aggregatable can be used in the aggregate transformation

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.RollupType.@Core.Description: The number of rollup operators allowed in a groupby transformation

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.Groupable.@Core.Description: This property can be used in the groupby transformation

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.Aggregatable.@Core.Description: This property can be used in the aggregate transformation

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.CustomAggregate.@Core.Description: Dynamic property that can be used in the aggregate transformation
Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.CustomAggregate.@Core.LongDescription: This term MUST be applied with a Qualifier, the Qualifier value is the name of the dynamic property. The value of the annotation MUST be the qualified name of a primitive type. The aggregated values will be of that type.

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.ContextDefining.@Core.Description: The annotated property or custom aggregate is only well-defined in the context of these properties
Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.ContextDefining.@Core.LongDescription: The context-defining properties need either be part of the result entities, or be restricted to a single value by a pre-filter operation. Examples are postal codes within a country, or monetary amounts whose context is the unit of currency.

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.LeveledHierarch.@Core.Description: Defines a leveled hierarchy by defining an ordered list of properties in the hierarchy

NodeProperty.@Core.Description: Property holding the hierarchy node value

ParentNavigationProperty.@Core.Description: Property for navigating to the parent node

DistanceFromRootProperty.@Core.Description: Property holding the number of edges between the node and the root node

IsLeafProperty.@Core.Description: Property indicating whether the node is a leaf of the hierarchy

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.isroot.@Core.Description: Returns true, if and only if the value of the node property of the specified hierarchy is the root of the hierarchy

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.isdescendant.@Core.Description: Returns true, if and only if the value of the node property of the specified hierarchy is a descendant of the given parent node with a distance of less than or equal to the optionally specified maximum distance

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.isancestor.@Core.Description: Returns true, if and only if the value of the node property of the specified hierarchy is an ancestor of the given child node with a distance of less than or equal to the optionally specified maximum distance

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.issibling.@Core.Description: Returns true, if and only if the value of the node property of the specified hierarchy has the same parent node as the specified node

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.isleaf.@Core.Description: Returns true, if and only if the value of the node property of the specified hierarchy has no descendants

Org.OData.Aggregation.V1.AvailableOnAggr.@Core.Description: This action or function is available on aggregated entities if the RequiredProperties are still defined
